intro: Troxirum villosum, commonly known as the hairy broomrape, is a parasitic plant that lacks chlorophyll and relies on host plants for nutrients. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in various regions of Europe and Asia. It has a complex life cycle that involves germinating on the roots of host plants and forming a symbiotic relationship. Due to its parasitic nature, it can have significant impacts on the growth and health of its host species.
